intro: Helichrysum rosum var. arcuatum, commonly known as the golden marguerite or African daisy, is a perennial plant native to South Africa. It features bright yellow, daisy-like flowers that are densely packed and often retain their color even when dried. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves that are typically grey-green in color. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it suitable for rock gardens and borders. Its compact growth habit and long flowering period make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
